caption: Table 2: Comparison to state-of-the-art on Kinetics-600.
Table 3: Comparison to state-of-the-art on Something-Something v2.
Table 4: Ablation study on different designs for spatiotemporal attention with Swin-T on K400.

Table 5: Ablation study on temporal dimension of 3D tokens and temporal window size with Swin-T 
on K400.

Table 5. In general, a larger 
temporal dimension leads to a higher top-1 accuracy but with greater computation costs and slower 
inference.
Table 6: Ablation study on the 3D shifted window approach with Swin-T on K400.
Table 7: Ablation study on the ratio of backbone lr and head lr with Swin-B on K400.

Table 8: Ablation study on the two initializa-
tion methods of linear embedding layer with 
Swin-T on K400.

Table 9: Ablation study on the two initial-
ization methods of 3D relative position bias 
matrix with Swin-T on K400.
